title: AI in classrooms: Will Indian schools bridge the digital divide?
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes learning globally, the traditional classroom model is under scrutiny. In India, gaps in digital infrastructure and teacher preparedness raise questions about how ready schools are for an AI-driven future. With only half of schools equipped with computers and internet, the challenge is both vast and urgent.
content: Some global scholars now predict that the traditional idea of a classroom could look very different by mid-century, with artificial intelligence (AI) reshaping who learns what, when and how. At a recent forum at Harvard Graduate School of Education, ... [8320 chars]

title: Google lays off over 100 cloud design staff after pushing employees to use AI in daily work
description: Google has trimmed its cloud workforce again, this time cutting more than 100 jobs in design-focused teams, as the company pushes harder towards artificial intelligence and tightens spending in other areas.
content: Google has trimmed its cloud workforce again, this time cutting more than 100 jobs in design-focused teams, as the company pushes harder towards artificial intelligence and tightens spending in other areas. The layoffs, as first reported by CNBC, aff... [3162 chars]

title: Don’t Expect a Cheaper Vision Pro Soon, As Apple Prioritises AI Glasses
description: Apple's forthcoming smart glasses are expected to rely on voice interaction and artificial intelligence heavily.
content:
Apple has reportedly paused the planned redesign of its Vision Pro mixed-reality headset, redirecting resources toward the development of smart glasses aimed at competing with Meta Platforms, according to a recent Bloomberg News report.

title: Satya Nadella hands off sales, marketing duties to focus on AI and data centres at Microsoft: Story in 5 points

title: Record Stock Rally Extends, OpenAI Lifts Asia Tech: Markets Wrap
description: (Bloomberg) -- A record-breaking global stock rally stretched into Asia, with equities advancing after OpenAI’s agreement with South Korean chipmakers reinforced enthusiasm for artificial intelligence.
content:

title: In a Sea of Tech Talent, Companies Can’t Find the Workers They Want
description: Employers racing for artificial-intelligence supremacy say they can’t find enough people with the most in-demand skills. | Business News
content:
What gives?
